intro: Knautia gussonei, commonly known as the Gussone's knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flower clusters that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Knautia gussonei is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
